body_html:
@apaszke I temporarily added the models here for your convenience to debug the autograd bug. Once the bug is fixed, I will remove the models from here.

The test to run is

python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_wlm_optim

and also

python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_vnet_optim

These both are failing with RuntimeError: Trying to backward through the graph a second time, but the buffers have already been freed. Specify retain_graph=True when calling backward the first time.

After the above bug is fixed, also verify that the following two tests are fine too

python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_resnet_optim
python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_densenet_optim

By fine means you will some some runtime stats printed out about 20 times.

body:
@apaszke I temporarily added the models here for your convenience to debug the autograd bug. Once the bug is fixed, I will remove the models from here.

The test to run is 
```
python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_wlm_optim
```

and also
```
python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_vnet_optim
```

These both are failing with ```RuntimeError: Trying to backward through the graph a second time, but the buffers have already been freed. Specify retain_graph=True when calling backward the first time.```

After the above bug is fixed, also verify that the following two tests are fine too
```
python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_resnet_optim
python test/test_memory_optimized.py TestMemoryOptimized.test_densenet_optim
```

By fine means you will some some runtime stats printed out about 20 times.
